comments:
I've installed 3.2RC5, then WST and J2EE via Callipso update site. Tomcat 5.5 has been installed and registered as server runtime.

When creating new web service client, upon hitting the Next button after selecting the project type, nothing happens. The same procedure did previously work with RC4.

Issue in comment 0 has been identified to be due to wrong server setup: tomcat server was setup with JRE instead of JDK. In this case, error message when creating web services client project would be expected.

After fixing initial issue as described in comment 1, web services client project can still not be created. When clicking next, following error message is presented:

IWAB0234E An internal error occurred. Details: null

I've seen bug 99728 mentioning IWAB0234E but believe this is different as a new project is created.
Bug 101337 mentions the same issue but ages old.

Please provide more info on project and server setup in your workspace.  Are you able to create a Web services client following the tutorial at:

http://www.eclipse.org/webtools/community/tutorials/WebServiceClient/WebServiceClient.html

We have run smoke testing using the above tutorial and everything works fine.
Mark, please follow up once more info is available on reproducing the problem.

Mhhm. Following the tutorial *is* tricky:

1) I'm skipping the step as I did not do the other tutorial. Not much going on there either except locating the wsdl file?

2) Selecting the Web Service Client wizard

3) Click next and that's already where the error occurs.

As I'm trying to create a Java client, I've not added any servers/runtimes to my project. The only server I have setup is a Tomcat 5.5 Server. 

For verification purposes I've created a separate EJB project containing the Tomcat. Server can successfully be started/stopped etc.

I've also tried creating a new Web Service Client by right-clicking on the WSDL file > Web Services > Generate Client. Error message is the same.

Additionally, I've also tried this tutorial: http://www.eclipse.org/webtools/community/tutorials/TopDownWebService/TopDownWebService.html.

Again, in step Create a top down Java bean Web service, the error message occurs when doing Open File-> New ->Other...-> Web Services-> Web Service-> Click Next.

The project is bound to Tomcat 5.5 running on JDK5. Error occurs regardless if Java Project Facet is set to 1.4 or 5.0.

Mark,
issue is now fixed. After experiencing the problems in Bug 143680 and applying the fix of deleting the server from project, the re-adding, the issue is gone.
It seems that the problem was due to me deleting der Servers project from my workspace that contains the definitions.

I'm currently unclear when/how this project is created. Apparently not at the time the runtime is added. Ideas?

Andreas,
Glad to hear that you were able to resolve this issue.  I'm not sure there is any bug in the Web Service Wizards though, I am able to go through those scenarios without running into any problems.

The servers project is created when creating a web service using the wizard.  I'm resolving this as worksforme.

Mhhm. The thing is that there is zilch indication of what could possibly be the root cause- only works if all steps before have gone exactly right. Even reinstalling Eclipse doesn't fix the problem in such a situation as the server settings are contained in the project settings. I've found my way through now, but it's not entirely selfexplaining?

CHeers,
Andi

Mark,
please see bug 144185 too. What seems to be missing in my eyes is a connection between creating a web servive java client and an app server. Why is the latter required to do the first? What settings does a project need to have to allow this?

Thanks,
Andi

Mark,
could you also check Bug 144185?

Thanks!

Mark,
I think I've found the original issue. The workspace's servers.xml contained a non-existing Default PHP Server from broken PHPMyEclipse install. I believer that this existing (broken) server hindered successful creation of the web service client.
